pandae667 wrote:
>
> .....
>
> Hi St.Ack,
>
> not sure if this was intentional or not, but from my point of view it
> seems like you forgot to add the junit test for the processor
> (JerichoExtractorHTMLTest.java)
>
> Regards
> Olaf freyer
>











Oversight on my part.  Fixed.  Thanks Olaf,
St.Ack




> > > Regards
> > > Olaf
> > > >
> > > > Excellent. I've made a couple of comments over in the issue. Take
> > > a look.
> > > > St.Ack
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > pandae667 wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Hi everyone @IA,
> > > > >
> > > > > I finally found the time to commit my JerichoHTMLExtractor to the
> > > > > SourceForge feature request section (id: 1573708). If anyone
> considers
> > > > > it useful, finds any bugs or any major design-shortcomings
> feel free
> > > > > to report.
> > > > > It basically performs all the tasks that ExtractorHTML does - plus
> > > > > filling out FORMs default values. The form handling part might
> still
> > > > > not be perfect but seems to work just fine in my environment.
> > > > >
> > > > > Regards
> > > > > Olaf Freyer
> > > > >
> > > > > > I also started work on a custom extractor based on
> HTMLExtractor.
> > > > > > My primary goal is to be able to fill out FORMs with default
> values.
> > > > > > I decided to not take the "regular expression"-way as the
> > > > > > HTMLExtractor currently does, but base my work on
> jerichoHTML parser
> > > > > > (http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net 
> <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net>
> > > <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net 
> <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net>>
> > > > > <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net 
> <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net>
> > > <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net 
> <http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net>>>).
> > > > > > The current results seem quite promising (it is just a few
> percent
> > > > > > slower than the HTMLExtractor but uses significantly less
> memory and
> > > > > > it passes all unit test that HTMLExtractor does).
> > > > > > If everything fares well I might be able to provide my
> extractor to
> > > > > > the cummunity next month.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Olaf Freyer
> > > > > >
> > > > >
